Here is a clear and concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:

* Requests the Secretary-General to create a Panel of Experts for an initial period of one year to assist the Committee in carrying out its mandate and gather information on implementation of measures imposed on the DPRK.
* Urges all States and relevant UN bodies to cooperate with the Committee and the Panel of Experts.
* Calls upon all Member States to prevent specialized teaching or training of DPRK nationals that could contribute to the DPRK's proliferation-sensitive nuclear activities.
* Calls upon the DPRK to join the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty and return to the Six Party Talks without precondition.
* Supports peaceful dialogue and urges all participants to intensify efforts on the full and expeditious implementation of the Joint Statement and joint documents.
* Expresses commitment to a peaceful, diplomatic and political solution to the situation and welcomes efforts to facilitate a peaceful and comprehensive solution.
* Affirms that it shall keep the DPRK's actions under continuous review and be prepared to review the appropriateness of measures, including strengthening, modification, suspension or lifting of measures, as needed.
* Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
